about.description:
HTMap is a library that wraps the process of mapping Python function
calls out to an HTCondor pool.  It provides tools for submitting,
managing, and processing the output of arbitrary functions.

Our goal is to provide as transparent an interface as possible to
high-throughput computing resources so that you can spend more time
thinking about your own code, and less about how to get it running on
a cluster.
about.summary: High-Throughput Computing in Python, powered by HTCondor

name: htmap

about.description:
HTMap is a library that wraps the process of mapping Python function
calls out to an HTCondor pool.  It provides tools for submitting,
managing, and processing the output of arbitrary functions.

Our goal is to provide as transparent an interface as possible to
high-throughput computing resources so that you can spend more time
thinking about your own code, and less about how to get it running on
a cluster.
about.summary: High-Throughput Computing in Python, powered by HTCondor

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "htmap" %}
{% set version = "0.6.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: ee3a0eb6b13bc7ef5747f951558a489edfe26a4d0f40242e87c0222766c63e4b

build:
  entry_points:
    - htmap = htmap.cli:cli
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python >=3.6
  run:
    - click >=7.0,<8.0.0a0
    - click-didyoumean >=0.0.3,<0.1.0a0
    - cloudpickle >=1.4,<2.0.0a0
    - halo >=0.0.28,<0.1.0a0
    - htcondor >=8.8.0
    - python >=3.6
    - toml >=0.10.0,<1.0.0a0
    - tqdm >=4.36,<5.0.0a0

test:
  imports:
    - htmap
  commands:
    - htmap --help

about:
  home: https://htmap.readthedocs.io/
  doc_url: https://htmap.readthedocs.io/
  dev_url: https://github.com/htcondor/htmap
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_family: APACHE
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: High-Throughput Computing in Python, powered by HTCondor
  description: |
    HTMap is a library that wraps the process of mapping Python function
    calls out to an HTCondor pool.  It provides tools for submitting,
    managing, and processing the output of arbitrary functions.

    Our goal is to provide as transparent an interface as possible to
    high-throughput computing resources so that you can spend more time
    thinking about your own code, and less about how to get it running on
    a cluster.

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - duncanmmacleod
    - jasoncpatton
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.3
